text: [Music]
I hope that I've been able to uh make
the world a better place I have have a
motto that I got from an artist who I've
known very well which is give more than
you take and I'm hoping that both for my
leadership and the fortunate success
that I've been able to have that I can
give more than I than I've taken and
both with employees philanthropic
Pursuits um mentoring people i' I'd like
to believe that I've kind of paid it
forward or continue to pay it forward
I've done scholarships here at HBS for
students and I basically ask them to do
one thing is if they're fortunate enough
to be successful to please do the same
because I think it's the way to give
back it's the right thing to do um and
this is such a special institution and
special school and I think it it really
has helped me uh formulate my thinking
on on how to give back I would say the
impact HBS out on me is kind of
multifaceted in the sense that it really
expanded my knowledge base and skill set
I only had two years of work experience
before coming here I'd worked at Goldman
Sachs and the exposure to thousands of
cases and people with varied backgrounds
and distinct backgrounds and different
perspectives I found to be really uh an
experience that was very difficult to
replicate taught me how to become a
better and more critical thinker which I
think is really important you know that
all the cases have decisions that are
not clear what the right decision it is
is and it helps give you a framework to
formulate the right answers to those
decisions so it's kind of like putting a
fire hose down your throat of
experiences and trying to make good
decisions and kind to see how they
panned out I created a great network of
contacts and friends with my best
personal friends or business school
graduates and classmates of mine both
section mates and classmates and I've
always found HBS has HBS graduates and
alumni who have an affinity to help each
other so you a very competitive group of
people
but they basically help each other
because we've had shared and similar
experiences which I think is a really
great aspect of the school the last
thing I would say is it kind of inspired
me to kind of go for it and dream big
and I think it gave me the tools the
knowledge the skill set and the
confidence to go for it upon graduation
so I'm greatly indebted to the school
and what it did for me
